title.value: A Rapid Method for Impact Analysis of Grid-edge Technologies on Power Distribution Networks
title.justification: Title of the paper is "A Rapid Method for Impact Analysis of Grid-edge Technologies on Power Distribution Networks"
title.quote: A Rapid Method for Impact Analysis of Grid-edge Technologies on Power Distribution Networks

extractions.description: This paper presents a novel rapid estimation method (REM) to perform stochastic impact analysis of grid-edge technologies (GETs) to the power distribution networks. The evolution of network statesâ€™ probability density functions (PDFs) in terms of GET penetration levels are characterized by the Fokker-Planck equation (FPE). The FPE is numerically solved to compute the PDFs of network states, and a calibration process is also proposed such that the accuracy of the REM is maintained for large-scale distribution networks. The approach is illustrated on a large-scale realistic distribution network using a modified version of the IEEE 8500 feeder, where electric vehicles (EVs) or photovoltaic systems (PVs) are installed at various penetration rates. It is demonstrated from quantitative analyses that the results from our proposed approach have negligible errors comparing with those obtained from Monte Carlo simulations.

type.justification: The paper utilizes quantitative analyses and compares results from the proposed method (REM) with those obtained from Monte Carlo simulations to demonstrate negligible errors.
type.quote: It is demonstrated from quantitative analyses that the results from our proposed approach have negligible errors comparing with those obtained from Monte Carlo simulations.

name.justification: The primary focus is on analyzing the impact of grid-edge technologies on power distribution networks.
name.quote: This paper presents a novel rapid estimation method (REM) to perform stochastic impact analysis of grid-edge technologies (GETs) to the power distribution networks.

name.justification: The study aims to perform stochastic impact analysis using probability density functions (PDFs) and the Fokker-Planck equation (FPE).
name.quote: The FPE is numerically solved to compute the PDFs of network states, and a calibration process is also proposed such that the accuracy of the REM is maintained for large-scale distribution networks.

name.justification: The research specifically deals with grid-edge technologies like electric vehicles (EVs) and photovoltaic systems (PVs).
name.quote: The approach is illustrated on a large-scale realistic distribution network using a modified version of the IEEE 8500 feeder, where electric vehicles (EVs) or photovoltaic systems (PVs) are installed at various penetration rates.

name.justification: The paper mentions the IEEE 8500 feeder as the primary dataset for demonstrating their approach.
name.quote: The approach is illustrated on a large-scale realistic distribution network using a modified version of the IEEE 8500 feeder, where electric vehicles (EVs) or photovoltaic systems (PVs) are installed at various penetration rates.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The IEEE 8500 feeder is referenced in the paper to validate the proposed method.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In this section, results from the stochastic impact analysis are illustrated on a test feeder. The IEEE-8500 test feeder

name.justification: The dataset is used for modeling photovoltaic system profiles under different weather types.
name.quote: 4 levels of PV nominal generation capacity are considered (1.6kW, 2.4kW, 3.6kW, 4kW). We consider 8 solar radiance profiles under different weather types [38], hence we have a total of 32 PV generation profiles in LPV.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is explicitly referenced in the paper for modeling solar radiation.

name.justification: The CYME software is used to model the modified network and to perform power flow analysis.
name.quote: The modified network is modeled in the CYME software which is also used to perform power flow analysis.

referenced_paper_title.justification: CYME software is a well-known tool from CYME International T&D, used for power system analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ... and analysis time also depends linearly on the maximum penetration level for both approaches. The modified network is modeled in the CYME software which is also used to perform power flow analysis.
